messages.subject: RE: [SHQ] Anyone know about this exhibit at the Edo Tokyo Museum?
messages.msgSnippet: Just from the look of it it seems to have been in conjunction with last year s Taiga drama. I wouldn t be surprised if it was still going on, though,
messages.messageBody:
Just from the look of it it seems to have been in conjunction with last
year's Taiga drama. I wouldn't be surprised if it was still going on,
though, especially considering that they're going to have the continuation
this coming year.

-M.

messages.subject: Anyone know about this exhibit at the Edo Tokyo Museum?
messages.msgSnippet: The article is dated July last year, so I don t know if the exhibit is even still there or not.  I can t really make too much of the translations I m getting,
messages.messageBody:
The article is dated July last year, so I don't know if the exhibit is
even still there or not. I can't really make too much of the
translations I'm getting, and the museum's English site is welcome,
but not very informative. From what I can tell you can't order from
their museum store online. Check out the cover to one of the exhibits
books at
http://allabout.co.jp/entertainment/kabuki/closeup/CU20040703A/shinsengumi002.jpg
It looks like it might have a lot of photos and information - and the
Edo Tokyo museum is known to be unusually English friendly.

Does anyone know anything else about this exhibit?

Thanks yo,
Michael
